title: Higher Education in Ireland : Practices, Policies and Possibilities
abstract: 1. The Transformation of Higher Education in Ireland, 1945-80 John Walsh 2. A Contemporary History of Irish Higher Education, 1980-2011 John Walsh 3. From Seaweed and Peat to Pills and Very Small Things: Knowledge Production and Higher Education in the Irish Context Andrew Loxley 4. Bildung and Life-Long Learning: Emancipation and Control Aidan Seery 5. Ireland and the Field of Higher Education: A Bourdieusian Perspective Michael Grenfell 6. Prospects for a Private, Indigenous and For-Profit University in Dublin David Limond 7. Measures and Metrics and Academic Labour Andrew Loxley 8. A Critical Journey Towards Lifelong Learning: Including Non-Traditional Students in University Ted Fleming and Fergal Finnegan 9. Student Experience and Engagement in Higher Education in Ireland Anne Murphy 10. Bologna: Consonance or Dissonance? Frank McMahon 11. Changing Curriculum and Assessment Mindsets in Higher Education Damien Murchan 12. E-Learning and Higher Education: Hyperbole and Reality Tom Farrelly 13. Academic Professional Development in Ireland Carmel O'Sullivan 14. Challenges and Opportunities for Teaching and Learning in Irish Higher Education Ciara O'Farrell
